v2WISN-4UvVSBGQyUA195Q.text: If you're looking for a nice homey breakfast/brunch this is a good place to go. The food is yummy and the hosts are welcoming and very friendly. Been going there for a few years and they have consistency with the quality of food and portions. Great family spot!

PPDbPBeFJOzOslVv7C5bGg.text: This was just OK.  I used to love this place.  The quality does not seem to be what it once was.  Nothing fresh/homemade it seems.  The menu raved about the butter for pancakes.  I failed to see what was so special.  I asked my server and she said it was whipped in house.  That is the Big deal?! REALLY???

XWiUcXhs4thAMi8Kf0PGJg.text: Great place for post colonoscopy breakfast with my honey.  Her colonoscopy not mine!!

E77mkDjgd72GZkXpaWXLpQ.text: Come before 9 on Sunday or you'll be waiting. The food selection is perfect for breakfast or brunch.  If you are looking for ambiance, this is not your place, but if you want a good, solid meal at a fair price with great service, then it IS your place. :)

dZ5NvMyKj5M5hgffqeYyfg.text: Since we moved to Charlotte, Le Peep has always been the go to place for breakfast. The food is great, the people are friendly and if you get there early enough on Sunday the lines aren't too long . . . yet. I always go for the french toast and bacon. It's fantastic. the skillets (The Lumberjack, The Wanderer, etc) are probably what they are known for but everything they make is delicious.  Also they have a program where you get one breakfast every time you get your card stamped 10 times.  Great place. But if you don't try it that's okay because the line will be just that much shorter when I want to go.

HqJ7D13LcTH4JeI3S7U8Hw.text: What a let down , I had the blueberry craps . More like blueberry crap . The craps it's self had no flavor . And was undercooked the waitress was not sufficient , I asked for extra napkins twice she didn't bring them . I'm not going back there..

FzbU44zNLneY3m1FkjWQsQ.text: Pretty quiet for 1 in the afternoon on a Friday. Decor leaves a lot to be desired- dark and gloomy inside on a bright day. We both had the Hen Pen. English muffin was burned, hash browns were so so but the sausage and scrambled eggs were fine (how could you screw those up?) Service was good, coffee was good. $20 for 2 seemed reasonable, but I am not inspired for a return trip.

7bawgBhAWdaJ-7F7jW8MNA.text: Average food, average service and slightly below average cleanliness. Overall not a bad dining experience but not a great one either.

8sFlILRXKcqW_0pU_6SqBQ.text: I really enjoy le peep. It is a great place to stop and get some tasty breakfast and their down home sausage pie skillet is the tops. The service every time I have been here is always fast and friendly and the prices are a little on the premium side but since the quality is so high you are getting what you pay for.   They are only open from 7-230pm every day so don't drag your feet getting here.   I can't really say enough good things about this place since the food is so awesome. The only thing I'd caution against is that if you are looking for a sunday breakfast/brunch get there early since it is usually packed out.

XXUw1laDPBz0dCzqITb3MA.text: Nothing special here, except that the pheasant potatoes are nice - crispy & not greasy at all.  Both regular & decaffeinated coffee is very weak.  High fructose corn syrup jams & syrups.

shT-MuGvuxXqW7ouRqtVWA.text: Wonderful breakfast!! I got an omelette, which was great. My mom had a waffle and it was one of the best I've ever had. It's about the same price as ihop but had such better value and more food!!! I will definitely come again. OJ was great. Warm syrup was warm without me having to ask.

ErJccyOMejnxKOmq-v0XGA.text: Nothing "sensationnel" about this place.  If you are looking for a french bistro feel go to Epcot.  The decor or lack of it was cold and run down. Pancakes and waffles looked good and were big.  Their sausage was tasty and the hot chocolate was rich . Everything else I tried meh. We ordered biscuits to start and they had a "reheated for a third time" texture and taste.  They were already cut in half so they could reheat the inside. I ordered the bagel sandwich trying to keep it simple but after a long session of jaw aerobics trying to chew the rubber-like, over-fried egg I only ate half from exhaustion.  The "Peasant Potatoes" were cold and not fresh and trademarked? WHY? Service was ok but making a line to pay is for fast food restaurants and the always reliable Waffle House.

S0FyatN5_jzWHv_MtCvJBw.text: Great breakfast/brunch food and surprisingly good prices for Ballantyne area.

OnA6krFQetfa6mM5nehODg.text: What a nice place to enjoy a tasty brunch!  Nice ambiance and good service on a busy Sunday morning. I particularly enjoyed the California Crepe with a side of fruit. All the meals that our group of 9 ordered were great!  The ingredients all seemed very fresh. Would definitely come back!

kW3IdDFr4fYJzssNX8tghQ.text: Fantastic place to bring your family, great food and service! Definitely going back with extended family!

v1ghqypaAQqQOit2MGiDLQ.text: Le Peep is your typical but delicious diner! I had the Hen Pen which was two eggs, three strips of bacon, potatoes and an english muffin. We were served our food quickly and devoured it just as quickly! I recommend Le Peep for a quick and simple breakfast

TBsDehtdQAdt0UClVrRE1A.text: The challah French toast paired with turkey bacon was a pretty awesome breakfast and I thoroughly enjoyed it; however, I felt the staff was lacking in service. They were very nice, just not very prompt and would disappear for quite some time.  I don't know if it was because a few people called out and they were short-staffed or if one should plan to stay awhile.  The food is very good, though.

zSux9Kn2AsoigfXkvMPvRw.text: So, I've been back. Breakfast was fantastic, completely different from my first experiences. I've been back several times now and love it. However, paying at the front is still an irritating experience at best. The Blarney Skillet and blueberry pancakes make up for it though.

38XAPGPjOH3JTVk50t4X3A.text: The wait was long on a Saturday morning without a reservation. The waitress was attentive to our large party. I ordered the cilantro lime chicken wrap and didn't expect much. Boy, was I wrong! Amazing! A small salad came with the wrap and the salad dressing tasted homemade.

IFp5Zycl0EhBlRqNxxyjwA.text: Cafeteria quality food and subpar service. Manager was quite rude when the server made a mistake on our order..... Their coffee drinks are delicious but it didn't make up for the rest.

jUAni0CyAciN503-N7LEsQ.text: Living in Charlotte for over 15 years, I am s00pah embarrassed how long it took me to try Le Peep, especially after going and finding everything DELICIOUS!!!  We went for a Saturday brunch around 1pm before I headed to work and were seated right away by a nice lady hostess. After a bit of a wait, our overworked waitress got our orders, drinks and left us looking at the kinda cheesy, kinda Roman, kinda Garden Ridge, kinda homey feeling decor. I didn't mind it but this place it's la-te-da so FYI for all you la-te-da kind folks out there!  I dove right in to the crab cake benedicts and home fries for my meal and I was not disappointed! Huge cakes, great seasoning, and potato chunks that are funky and chunky in all the best ways, I was singing a song of MMMM and OMMMM on my side of the table all meal! Definitely would get again in a heart beat!  The date got pancakes but honestly forget which ones, but end of the story is that he said they were amazing too and we left with ZERO doggie bags in tow.  All in all, I am looking forward to going back again - we got out for under $30 for 2 people and that's a WIN!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab cakes Benedict

EsZoSMTdD1dF8_BYEgnHuQ.text: Yum!  My breakfast was excellent. I got a veggie skillet, and it was huge. I only ate half, and that's a rare problem for me. It had potatoes, zucchini, green ask red bell peppers, red onions, mushrooms, and about a cup of cheese. Healthy, not really. But delicious!  My guy had the lumberjack, and he said it was good.  Everything seems to be served with their peasant potatoes, which are really just home fries.  They offer both turkey bacon and turkey sausage for those who prefer that.

dBbV2aIB0P3enE3TLEFIKw.text: Le Peep is pretty Le Great.  I really enjoyed my meal here as I'm a huge fan of breakfast anytime of the day.  I had a egg white omelette and it was delicious.  I did however have a couple drawbacks to mention unfortunately.    First was the time it took for visits to the table.  A little too much time in between visits created an issue where I literally had to go to the host station to request my check and pay for my bill.  The server was great mind you, but maybe overloaded.    Secondly, the salsa given was pretty hot, temperature wise.  I'm not a fan of hot salsa and I prefer it cold because the tomato dices don't disintegrate that way.    On the plus side, if the weather is nice it's a real treat to sit outside and soak up all that is suburbia.

4oTu-qZIJ9L7H5DvdSU4TA.text: I want to love this place I really do but it was only okay for me. So first of all my service here was excellent probably it's biggest saving grace for me at this point and the ONLY reason for 3 stars. But now on to the food...  I ordered the cafe Vienna (all of their espresso drinks supposedly have two shots of expresso as is standard) but it tastes just like the International house Cafe Vienna mix you get at the grocery store blah!! No way there is espresso in that!  I asked my very attentive (sometimes overly so, but I was by myself) waitress what her suggestions were. She suggested the 18 wheeler which I had considered and then a bunch of super sweet things. So I went with the 18 wheeler which consists of 2 eggs, 2 sausage links or bacon, French toast, and their peasant potatoes.  Now my first red flag (after the coffee) was that I got my food less than 5 min after ordering??!  My eggs were scrambled like I asked but they were too wet for my taste, ( a lot of people like that so I didn't factor it into my rating). The sausage came highly recommended and it was my favorite part of the meal!! The French toast was okay, rather dry, but nothing special about it and the peasant potatoes while well seasoned were so dry not even ketchup could rescue them.   Now as I've sat here I've noticed people's food comes almost immediately after they order just like mine did... I hope theirs is hotter than mine was as everything on my plate was lukewarm and some of it very cold. I'd rather wait 20 min for food and get it hot than have cold food and no wait!!   I hear they have great sandwiches so I'll have to come back for lunch one day but as far as breakfast goes its a miss for me!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast at Le Peep (the 18 wheeler)

3cSqyFZeP2_u_FICSn4opw.text: I seriously can't think of any breakfast/brunch joint better than Le Peep. I literally always get the drifter skillet because it's so good and can't imagine even trying anything else. The coffee here is even really good and I'm extremely picky when it comes to coffee. Now although you might have to wait 10/15 minutes in the small area in the front it's totally worth it for the amazing food, great service and all around atmosphere! Thumbs up!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. A little hesitant to not get breakfast here but I&#39;m so glad I got this. Salmon wrap was AMAZING!

eY03_3lZ6sxos_MDdxc_dw.text: Great service and terrific food. Perfect for lunch. I have never been disappointed. Service is always fast and super friendly.

Wy7q6dTCR25mLjHWOFnezw.text: Consistently great breakfast food for a reasonable price. I am a creature of habit and always order the Harvest Eggs Benedict, which features a melange of sauteed veggies and a side of their savory potatoes.   The service is great, but the only downside to this place is they close at 2:30p, and the wait can be long (on the weekends) during breakfast/brunch time. If you get there after that time period you will be seated quickly.

6y8nX74RoFnd-B2ynp_bCg.text: Our Server and the cashier were not all that friendly and the food was just ok. Their syrup is gross and cheap and they don't serve Heinz ketchup. We won't return.

bCt6rpDSBJEX54h_qguoNQ.text: Our weekend breakfast spot. Eggs benedict with salmon or the classic with ham - eggs poached perfectly, crusty English muffin, cream cheese and salmon with spinach.  Very tasty Skillets are great too - crunchy toasty potatoes with a host of mix-ins (ham, bacon, mushrooms, tomatoes, cheese, whatever!) and then poached eggs on top for the finish. Great kids menu. French toast is delicious, chocolate chip pancakes, fresh fruit (good fruit too). When it's warm the outdoor seating is wonderful.   Waiters can take a while but if you're there to relax, it's perfect timing.

5E8l_isVjyRlw2BnqhuqfQ.text: We tried this restaurant and the food was bland but okay. A few weeks later, we decided to try different items as takeout. Hoping they were better. I went in to get the takeout and they forgot an item,so, they had me pay and then wait for the missing item. It took them 20 minutes to cook the missing item,meanwhile,the rest of the food was getting cold. They gave me the missing item and I left. While walking to my car, the manager comes outside after me, yelling loudly at me in front of other Arboretum Shoppers" You have to pay! You cannot steal food! You have to pay for all of that!"  I was so humiliated! I explained what happened while showing my receipt and the manager said I had to return to the restaurant. I returned,found the employee who screwed up the order and had rung up my purchase. The employee apologized repeatedly and verified that I had paid and the manager,instead of apologizing,said"well then,you can go." I said I was not leaving there without a full refund. I said I was returning their food,since they had humiliated me and did not apologize. The manager told me they did not allow food to be returned and I would not be refunded. I opened the containers of cold food and said I would contact the owner if I was not refunded for the entire bill,since they screwed up my order causing the food to go cold ,due to the lengthy wait,and then humiliated me for no reason.  They refused to refund me,so, I left the cold food there,telling them I would never eat there again and I would make sure all of my friends and neighbors knew how rudely they had treated me. The manager said it was a simple mistake and that screaming at me that I was a thief was not humiliating and they were happy I would not be back. So, if you are okay with the way they treated me,then,I guess,go ahead and eat there.However,even without their horrendous treatment,I would not return. The food is very bland. Try Another Broken Egg, Sky View Diner, Flying Biscuit,IHOP or even Cracker Barrel is not as bland!  They will all treat you with respect and serve you way better food!

vg9HXcwDiBiKhABQVs3tvA.text: Chocolate Chip Pancakes or the regular Pancakes with LOTS of Whipped Butter?  Both are really good and are making a BIG Breakfast!  Today it was Chocolate Chip Pancakes with just a little Whipped Butter because I have to lose weight and I have high Cholesterol (I counting this as a public proclamation that I'm going to do something about it, on Monday).  Three Links of "Hawg-Wild" Sausage, I was planning on eating two and taking one home and I did!  This is one of my favorite links of Sausage... It has a good flavor and i give it 4 yelp stars!  Hash Browns "Cubed and Fried" (on a hot griddle) is one of my favorite Potato preparations...  This was my only disappointment and not a big one. I have had these before, forgot that I did not care for them here and ordered them today.  Since "Eddies Place" is King of this "hash brown" style, Le Peep gets 3 stars for the potatoes.   The Service here is laid back, which I appreciate since I am almost never in a hurry.  I notice each time I have eaten here, none of the patrons seem to be in a hurry!!!  A leisurely Breakfast, with the one you LOVE or, or, or alone.  I'll probably have a date next time!  Patio and outdoor Dining!  This is a cool, cozy, partially private (in a nice way) spot!  Reminds me of the Charming Cafe (not the one in the Opening and Closing Scenes) in the movie "Ronin" though it looks nothing like the Cafe in the Movie, it is the Romantic idea for me!  No fan of most Chains, here is one of my FEW exceptions!  When I finally decided to move to Charlotte I was glad for Le Peep!  Las Colinas is where I first fell in Love with Le Peep... This was a weekend long Bachelor Party for Robbie the Love Knobby and when one of the guys (it was all guys) chose the Restaurant we thought he was kidding... "We said what is it ?"  He said "French", we said "What"???  "Le Peep" ...So we thought maybe we were going to the chain "Popeye's", cause it was a joke taking a bunch of men to a French Restaurant for Breakfast..  So we were saying "Le Popeye"... This guy was not kidding and that was my introduction to Le Peep!  I fell in Love!  The Love Affair continued in the next spot when I was considering moving the the Phoenix/Scottsdale Area... Another Le Peep!  This one may be gone now???

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. I did NOT eat the whole Table full of food!  I cut out a small slice to take home for later!
Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate Chip Pancakes!  Hope my &#34;Health Coach&#34; doesn&#39;t see these!
Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Hawg-Wild&#34;

EEXIfq1DXZXmDyifAhM07g.text: Love it here.  The Panini s are fabulous, fries always good and service is great.  Everything coming out to nearby tables looked amazing as well.  Can't wait to come back to try something else!

7rga7r5PalGQPVq0i2N4sw.text: The perfect breakfast/brunch spot! Le Peep has something for everyone, and dishes you just won't find anywhere else. The Green Fields Forever is my go to, but you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Not to mention that the owner and staff are some of the best. A definite must for anyone in the area.

SYH5RYJ4ctT-4tcMQNNR1g.text: Great blueberry pancakes served w/hot syrup & hot blueberry compote. Terrible coffee!

-zSvrIKN-uRmwh3OIWn3MA.text: So many of the breakfast places in this area are really hit-or-miss in terms of food and service... but for me, Le Peep consistently serves good food.  And lately, the service has been much better for us.   Here, I am never disappointed with my food.  I like the fact that they will happily substitute items without making a huge deal of it.   We figured this place would be a zoo on Christmas Eve, but it was not - no wait for a table, yay!

c3v72w6lt1OEsAZAJSWeRA.text: Dear Le Peep,   I am a New England girl who frequently winds up wandering around down South.  I was passing through Charlotte, and I was in need of some premium breakfast noms.  The eggs bene was delicious.  I especially liked the "sassy apples." This inspired an inside joke which repeated itself endlessly for several days as my friend and I could not get over the idea that apples could, in fact, be 'sassy.' If apples can be sassy, what can't be sassy?  Approved nom-worthy. I may be back here someday!

9tBktgOmzMeuJbKSMvWPUg.text: Let's just start off by saying that I will not return to this location.  This is a chain that has a surprisingly loyal following, but I will not be part of that multitude and here is why.  The interior has no sound abatement, so one cannot hear or understand the waitress.  This morning it was only a third full and I cannot possibly imagine what a roar it would be if it were full of patrons.  I ordered eggs over medium, sausage and potato, along with "plain" English muffin and juice.  My son ordered scrambled eggs, potato and corned beef hash.    Upon pretty fast service we were confronted with my fried eggs well-done hard, potato so dry that they sucked all the moisture from your mouth and were flavorless to boot.  Not a lick of salt, onion, oil, parsley or anything other than those miserable potato rectangles.    Sausages were good, flavorful and not greasy.  The "plain" English muffin came with the oil that they try to pretend is butter.  I handed the muffin to the waitress and reminded her that I wanted "plain".  She promptly informed me that they had two types of muffin, plain and whole wheat and I ordered plain.  This is when my son and I exchanged glances and knew, really knew that this was not our day to buy lottery tickets.  It is like ordering "regular" coffee in Mass and getting cream and sugar in it.  So be careful in your vocabulary or your expectations will be shattered.  Seek clarity from you waitress, if you can hear her and if she can her you.    My son's corned beef was straight out of the can, it just had been heated and broken apart from the can shape before serving.    We both left disappointed.  When the cashier asked "how was everything" she was simply going through the formula motions because she did not miss a beat in making change along with my silence.  It seemed that Le Peep is asleep both up front and in the kitchen.  I did look at the computerized bill and there was no descriptor for how eggs were to be cooked or for the muffin.  They must just trust the kitchen to cook it as they see best at any given time and if the waitress (yes, they were all females) is not on top of them the patron is at the mercy of the kitchen crew's judgement.  With so many restaurants and other forms of eating establishment in Charlotte don't waste your time at this particular Le Peep.  It appears that they are not worth a peep.

9O57eUKPzP2aJAEmHZmzJg.text: Skillets...... yum!  I like all breakfast places, but any place that can pull off a decent skillet moves to the top of my list.  They have all the usual breakfast items (benedicts, egg platters, etc), but, IMO, their skillets are what separates them from other breakfast joints.  My favorite = The Wanderer or The Mega.  My daughter loves the chocolate chip pancakes (duh).  Wife loves their Belgian waffles.  Staff members are friendly.  Wait staff hustles.  The arrival and check out processes are a little kooky (meaning there's not much space to wait when you first walk in, which happens to be the same place others are lining up to pay after their meal), but other than that, this place works for us.

3fXiC_ePgFd9W9G6Dbq3tA.text: Le Peep is absolutely delicious, and the customer service can't be beat! Get a skillet; you won't regret it!

0ZL-mFQYWKSKsTZtREfhOg.text: This place is, it's okay. I guess.   Sunday brunch rolls around and I love brunch so I like to go to different brunch places. Most reviews were pretty alright and when we got there a lot of tables were empty since it was about 1pm. I like to sleep late, okay?  I ordered the eggs benedict "Irish", which is served with corned beef hash instead of ham. It was really weirdly crunchy, and I didn't finish it. My friend ordered a skillet (I am not exactly sure of which one) and their cheese was also crunchy. The cheese, it was crunchy. Why was the cheese crunchy? He also ordered a single biscuit with gravy and he got a single biscuit with some type of white gravy. The gravy had large sliced up pieces of sausage and he did not finish it.   I also ordered a coke, and it was really syrupy and tasted as if the ice had melted in it but they just put more coke in it to cover that. Soda is a hard thing to screw up on, but if you do that successfully then I worry about you.  The service was meh. Our server looked unhappy and distant, sort of like a girlfriend who is mad at her boyfriend but isn't going to tell him why and when he asks she says "nothing", which is a lie because everything is wrong. Trust me, everything.

OacyYgH7WVHCeWWyOAcYBQ.text: Mom and I went here for brunch on a Tuesday. Mom ordered the Hen Pen (I think) with turkey sausage and "very soft" scrambled eggs. I got the turtle mocha and Salmon & Avocado wrap with waffle fries. Lisa our server was very knowledgable and on top of things. My wrap was so delicious; the only thing being that the feta was so unevenly distributed, I only tasted it in one big clump in one of the wrap halves! Also, the mocha she brought out wasn't the one in the "turtle mocha" description; I didn't taste the caramel and it was missing the crumbled walnuts. Mom's dish was great...until she got to the eggs. They were so visibly NOT soft scrambled, I was kind of disappointed Lisa even brought them out. She offered to take them back, but mom's been watching those "bad restaurant" shows and she was hungry so they just stayed on the plate and, predictably, weren't eaten. It was mom's second time coming there, and the first time far out-shined this one, just on the basis of getting her eggs wrong this time.

YNnOK3d1mUVQXKpBJsexQA.text: Eaten here many times (breakfast only) and I have never walked away unhappy!  The service is fast and the food is great.

treKpNzlF7SFN6pHnY5Jmw.text: For a breakfast place, it doesn't get very crowded which is rather nice. I hate waiting for a table. Their eggs benedict is rather fabulous, as are their signature granny apples and breakfast potatos. Perfect for brunch!

O2mnH-N7yBD3qlu_xA5RLw.text: I love Le Peep.  Its even worth the drive from East Blvd all the way to the Arboretum, just to enjoy their delicious Breakfasts, and fast friendly service.  I really like the sausages here, they are big and plump, and they have that outer covering made of skin that pops when you first put your fork through it, and the meat and grease come gushing out, oh yeah.  Le Peep also has some massive delicious pancakes, I'm partial to the Blueberry, but all of them are good.  Sundays are really busy, so be ready to wait a little, but if its a nice Carolina day, grab a seat outside and enjoy the fresh air with your orange juice and eggs.  They cook their over easy eggs really well, also.  When my girl and I go there we usually get the Lumberjack Breakfast, and split it, and then I get a side of eggs and sausage, and we're good to go.

IyUuha6WmRCBSj4oSBpoQQ.text: Love this place! Spanish omelette is the best! We try to go a few times a month. Frequent eater card is a nice bonus. Definitely try this place!

QphR6GmfApPebBrd6Z_dkQ.text: Some folks are of the opinion that it's damn near impossible for a restaurant to screw up breakfast. Trust me, it's possible. And while to say that Le Peep screws it up would be an exaggeration, they don't exactly get it right either. For the price and the wait, I'd expect that they'd do much better.

3aSrGuh8Y_iPMB4Pss42-w.text: We'd received a Groupon gift certificate for them and had brunch there today. We went online and reviewed the menue, which was standard breakfast items. Called ahead to get our names on the seating list. Good idea, the wait was at 20 minutes when we arrived. Got seated pretty quickly but next to the kitchen. Ordered a Cafe Mocha, came quickly and was pretty good. Our food order came pretty quickly as well considering the crowd. Got a lot of food for the price but it was pretty average tasting and bland, not well seasoned at all. I'll give thm a thumbs up on the service and quantity of the food, but the quality is what's keeping me from coming back.

pdwrh7BgMoZOU3kGybXJ0Q.text: VERY BAD EXPERIENCE.  My husband and I ate brunch at Le Peep in Charlotte today, 12/13/10.  It was our first and last visit.  Online there was a nice menu and what looked like an upscale restaurant.  I purchased a Groupon certificate so that we at there even though the floors were dirty, many table cloths were ripped, and it was cold. The first thing to arrive was my cappuccino.  I looked around for cinnamon, as there was none served with the drink or on the table, I had to walk up to the cashier to obtain some.  Eventually my husband's order arrived, minus the avocado that was a feature of the omelet.  Had he been notified upon ordering or shortly thereafter that there was NO avocado available, he would have ordered something different.  I also had a problem with my crepe.  The crepes were only room temperature as were the potatoes.  I did not send them back, because it had taken a long time to arrive at our table, and I wasn't going to have my husband wait for me to receive my order and sit there while I ate it with nothing in front of him.  The bacon was of poor quality.  Prior to leaving, my husband used the men's room and the stall closure was broken, hanging down, unusable.  That was something anyone who cares for the restroom would have seen.   It was all extremely disappointing, and I would never eat there again, and I certainly would not recommend it to anyone.   It was really bad.

g4aEKog-TbJLIBHoNpVzdA.text: Although I have been to this restaurant many times, the quality of the food and service has declined. My father ordered the Spinnaker and was served a spinach quiche. He didn't want to complain so he kept it but the crust was so hard that he could hardly eat it. I ordered the Harvest salad with grilled chicken and the chicken was burned so that it was completely black. My mother's order, the salmon wrap, was the only dish that came out correctly. Our server never returned to our table to check on us until she brought the bill. Very disappointing meal.

f-RRzwyGdQtHk5WXjdkI0A.text: We just weren't impressed by this place. The food was just OK... nothing special. The "peasant potatoes" that are supposedly seasoned are really just plain home fries with no seasoning at all. The cheese and tomato panini was plain and unsatisfying. It was prepared on a sub roll and not a banquette. Waffle fries were good though.

ZxQwfO5JXqqdGu1vBuqWMw.text: Upscale from the usual diner breakfast, this was solidly delicious with great service and great food. After reading the reviews and the tips, I chose the pancakes, which came with bacon and an egg. Bonus points for being able to poach it and as well for the bacon being cooked just the way I like it - not burned and crispy but cooked through. And the pancakes? Excellent. Thick and fluffy and tasty.  Coffee was good. Served with a carafe so I wouldn't have to wait for a waitress to notice my empty cup. Why don't more places do it this way?

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pancake sandwich breakfast
Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States

_5jJxa-35S0trT5k4mTo9Q.text: Our family of 6 went to LePeep to have breakfast on a Friday morning at 9:00. The restaurant was half empty and many tables were waiting for their food. The hostess made us wait until she said they could pull a couple of tables together but we saw no evidence of this happening. After 30 minutes we left. And the hostess didn't seem to care. In hindsight they were probably slowing everyone down because the kitchen could not keep up with the orders coming in. Very disappointing! We won't be back. Hire adequate staff or lose customers...your choice Owners of Le Peep!

VKjx5RauwvHmBmczi-d73A.text: Great place. I was there recently based on other reviews and it is close to home. I am a breakfast anytime person so this place is likely to see me a few times a month.  Eggs and the breakfast potatoes were very nicely done.  The vibe is a little loud so don't go expecting an intimate scene with quiet conversation. They get busy but I see satisfied people leaving and smiles coming in.  Very good breakfast experience.

M3SpYr5bb_UqBZltt7C5DQ.text: Sunday breakfast is my favorite meal of the week, and a good yogurt & granola parfait with fruit is my favorite breakfast, so I was pretty excited to see that Le Peep had a Breakfast Banana Split on their menu, which on the website was listed as "bananas, strawberries, yogurt and granola."  Yum. Perfect.    Upon arriving at Le Peep and taking a glance at the menu, I saw that it was listed as bananas, strawberry syrup, strawberry yogurt and granola.  Hmmmm, not as excited.  What came out was an old banana split in half in a bowl of store-bought strawberry yogurt with frozen blueberries and strawberries in their respective juices.  It was a lot of liquid all meshing together wrong and tasting pretty processed.  The coffee was pretty bad, and I'm no coffee snob.    The fella got corned beef hash with potatoes, eggs and an English muffin.  He said the English muffin and eggs were the best part... I couldn't even see any seasoning on the potatoes, and he said he couldn't taste any either.  The atmosphere leaves a lot to be desired with Pepto-Bismol colored walls, wood paneling and stenciled stone murals.  The service was great, but the place just felt... sad.  Perhaps we should've caught on to the fact that the Manhattan Bagel place two shops down was more busy than the actual breakfast place.

4gIuY4azMz6EamW_agRLrA.text: One of my favorite french bistros that was in WI and I found it here in Charlotte. Love the breakfast and brunch selection.  Pancakes are crazy huge and cake like, bacon crispy and decent peasant potatoes.   Great for a brunch spot under $15 Location is decent for walking after being so full!   Check it out!

d2MwhUKI-BpvuBn9ihWfSA.text: They do breakfast right.  I went here this morning for ghee first time with my friend and our two 7 month olds.  The service was fast and the food was very good.  I ordered a broccoli and cheddar cheese omelette which came with potatoes and buttered toast.  The omelette was a little smaller than I'm used to and a little dry, but it was good.  The potatoes were mostly good but some were burnt.  The toast was buttered, which is important to me.  I appreciate when they do that work for you.  I ordered my son a single pancake... It was huge!  I ended up eating over 90% of it and can only describe it as a giant fluffy sugar cookie-- which is a good thing.  I'll definitely be returning.

zHYcweNsxpW-DdKeGFRalA.text: What a perfect breakfast spot! I have been looking for something like this since I moved to Charlotte and so happy I tried it out. The potatoes are crisp and perfect. The omelette was huge and tasty. Pancakes were fluffy. But my favorite thing was the link sausage! That was great! I have been coming here for a while now and still have tons more to try on the menu. I highly suggest this place if you are looking for a nice touch on southern breakfast! Oh and I have to mention that no matter how busy they are you get your food very fast! Keep it up!

5xxaT5XuEmmVlRsHl06aFg.text: This is one of Ballantyne's best kept secrets! Nestled away in the Arboretum, I was not expecting to find such an amazing and delicious European-esque cafe! The food is SO delicious-far better than any chain breakfast joint or diner! The staff is friendly and attentive. The atmosphere is warm and comforting, but still modern and chic. Oh and the coffee? Better than I've had at any restaurant or cafe! This place will become my new favorite for sure!

88RBRvjEu1yOPtDyHYCT9w.text: On a road trip to New York, we decided to stop in Charlotte for the night, before heading out the next morning a friend recommended that we have breakfast at Le Peep.   It was the best suggestion and detour.  The wait was a little bit long, but definitely worth the wait.  The food was home-style cooking all the way, and the prices very affordable.  No doubt that the next time I'm in Charlotte, we'll be back.  But if you're lucky you might find one in your town as they are a chain restaurant.

iMbDY5Oiy3V-YEASaQQ6ww.text: I would love to give this place a better rating given that it is in my local community, but I just can't.    I have been there about 3 times now for breakfast, trying different things each time and it just keeps disappointing.  From the Biscuits and gravy to the Breakfast burrito (which says includes Chorizo, but that is some funky looking and tasting Chorizo) it is just an overall bland and half hearted attempt at breakfast.  Nothing taste fresh made.  It must all come from pre-packaged previously frozen boxes.    The ambiance is just a mediocre place to have breakfast/lunch.  Nothing on the inside has an aesthetic appeal to it.  They do have a little bit of outside seating, but even it is old run down patio furniture that is going to leave some sort of stain on your clothing.  The staff is just "OK"  they get the job done, but there isn't a rush to provide timely and quality service.   Again, this place is just not that good for the price.

oxqZyjlw0yy1jBH2d4fs7Q.text: I think I have found my new lunch spot! I went here for lunch today although I ate breakfast. I had the Mega Skillet which was absolutely delicious. The bacon was crispy and fresh and the sausage in it was very good. Loved the basted eggs on top. I will definitely go back here again. I want to try the crepes out. The service was a little slow for me but thats ok I will go back here again.

-xyR1YMeJIQpznFqMOrceA.text: Pancakes were thick and the portion size for kids was generous. My hubs got the skillet - wanderer - and it was good. I had the lumberjack breakfast - I think it was called and it was good. This wasn't a five star because it didn't wow me. Everything was average except the skillet and pancake...those were above. The grits were below average and I'm certain I could've made better at home. We would go back and get their crepes because they looked delicious. I'll also try a latte.

mhfAIRcAOofkF07-kAyZ6A.text: This is a good place for breakfast/brunch. The wait was minimal (15 min) on a Sunday mornjng. The food was good and came out within a short time. I had the Lumberjack Breakfast. The pancakes were too "cakey". Next time I ll try another option. Overall a good dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Belgian Waffel Breakfast
Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Lumberjack Bteakfast.  2 eggs,2 bacon strips,breakfast potatoes and 2 pancakes.

qnyYWaacTVuUEKBcykAhLg.text: Food eh! Service eh! Patrons..germ infested. I have had a woman behind me for almost an hour hacking her germs all over the place and not covering her mouth. Not the restaurant's fault but it didn't make my first visit pleasurable. Now the food...  I waited more than 15 minutes waiting on my Cafe Vienna.. when my food finally arrived..it wasnt what I ordered. Once the correction was made, first bite is flavorless. The only flavor I received was from the hollandaise sauce.  Apparently the chef had saltitis because there wasn't a trace of seasoning in my food.  Huge disappointment. Will I visit again? Hard to say yes. My server was pleasant but thats not enough to commit to a second visit.

yhqW7RRMgSezHFn47bKfug.text: Terrific service, HOT decaf, great egg choices and very good pancakes.prices are most reasonable too.a good breakfast choice.

J8W-TTZUSzuymMoUoN-XtA.text: Took my mom to eat here a couple weeks ago when she came to visit. It was a really good place to eat. The time I decided to come it was a little busy but everyone is very attentive and very helpful in helping out with the menu. I say that because my mom is a vegetarian and they help this order stuff that she can eat. Very good place for breakfast

JuFjKhvw5D1Tph9MFGZjrQ.text: For the amazing location this place has, and the number of tables full, I had high expectations.  However, I thought the food here was just ok.  The staff was very friendly and the menu had plenty of what looked like great selections, but when my food arrived, I was disappointed.  My "breakfast potatoes" were dry, and a bit tough.  It's like they'd been baked, then fried.  Whatever it was, the texture was all wrong.  My egg dish was bland and a bit watery from the veggies in it.  It just created a kind of soup in the bottom of the dish, not very appealing.  My meal wasn't very hot, and even the toast seemed off, like the bread was already slightly stale.  The coffee was good and the prices weren't bad, but in search of breakfast, I'll keep searching.  This place just didn't do it for me.

XKFKpbgvZwElqIJix3C5AA.text: They have a lot of vegetarian options and a few items can be made vegan, you just have to ask your server. I had a really sweet waitress who called the bakery to double check if their sourdough had eggs or dairy (no eggs, iffy on the dairy) and gave a suggestion for a scramble with no eggs or cheese. I ended up ordering it and it tasted great! FYI their potatoes are fried in the same oil as the meat but they can bake them desperately, it just takes a little longer. Thank you for taking care of my needs Le Peep!

64-3PwwTQhc5ab7rsxiU4A.text: I have been going to Le Peep for more than 15 years - I really do like the food but there are times on the weekends that the service can be a little questionable. They serve coffee on carafes and it's honestly never enough for the table..... there are times when you ask for a refill that it seems off-putting to the waitstaff. That said, the pancakes and food are always fresh and done right when we go and that's why we keep going back. They customize (eggs whites versus regular eggs, scrambled versus over-easy) and always get it right. That says something!! It's not the cheapest breakfast, but they're no different than the numerous other weekend breakfast joints around CLT. We are happy LePeep is here and will continue to be post-church regulars.

7mRX_jDTtjtLsPNjVMKoGQ.text: Anytime I'm on this side of Charlotte I stop at Le Peep. Love their lunch (buffalo panini and fries yum) and French toast is the best I've had.

zFY9KkFY3BMIDNxMWaDTlw.text: The best Apple Walnut Pancakes ever! The best pancakes we've ever had! Crab Cake Benedict was delicious. It was a busy Sunday, but we only waited 5 mins before getting seated. Our waitress Nina could have been more helpful. She seemed new. Other than that, our food came out unbelievably fast!   When being served at a restaurant, it is important to have good customer service. So this is why I'm rating this place 4 stars.   Food was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Cake Benedict and Apple Walnut Pancakes. Delicious.

3NHOb7NjrXGpNItCEJ6CvA.text: Le Peep is le average and the service is le not good.  I have been here twice and both times were the same. Service is unorganized and overwhelmed. Things are always slow. The eggs Benedict wasn't cooked well and was cold. The breakfast sandwich did not taste fresh. Coffee drinks weren't good either. Server never came back to check on us or to refill waters. Had to find her to ask for check. Took about twenty mins after a wait to order food.

PrRC0FC0HDQlsRXjL9UsEw.text: One of my regular breakfast spots. The food is excellent and the service has really improved!

QJP6flGeozMywHVe8DDD3Q.text: I had heard of LePeep for years ..... both positive and negative opinions. My recent breakfast experience was mixed. One of a group of 5, I was happy 5hat we were able to be seated quickly. Though I didn't find the hostesses particularly welcoming, our waitress was very friendly, knowledgeable and efficient. The menu was a mix of every day favorites as well as some specialty items. The  choices were amazing and certainly tempting. Everyone in my party got something different. My own more traditional breakfast was okay but not any more than that. The temperature of my eggs and grits was tepid at best. I was also taken aback slightly at the price. For an ordinary meal I  thought it was pricey. Paying at the counter I was once again disappointed in the cool demeanor of the staff. No thank you, how was it, or hope to see you again. I don't know if I will return because I've enjoyed better meals, better prices and a more friendly ambiance at other restaurants.

IimI_wg6t4QoEDbkWJsVcg.text: How have I just tried this amazing restaurant? We went for breakfast and it was really really good. Entela welcomed us when we got there and was very nice. The waffle with the strawberry sauce from the crepes is nothing short of amazing. My son had the french toast which he and I both loved. The home fries are so good too. Sydney is the best waitress I have had in the Charlotte area. She has the best manners and is so friendly and attentive. I wish I lived in Arboretum to go more often. Can't wait to come back!!

aNX4kZDZ4RZhk9Xr8yIhGw.text: The food was good as usual. Service was great. The pancakes were perfect!!!! The samoa latte was DELICIOUS oh m gee it was sooooo sweet! We loved it. Ok

SP07YHIdo2JXssiKgWHraQ.text: Food is pretty good! Good eggs benedict. Not crazy good but solid  Prices and portions just right. TheCustomer service could be better. Waitress lacked luster and did not seem very enthusiastic.

2_ENfmZX9jt_d5KndxJSOg.text: Decided to go here for a quick lunch because we'd heard so many good things about it. The menu sounded really great and we had a tough time deciding what to get but we both ultimately ended up disliking what we ordered. The chicken panini was tough, dry and had barely anything in it. The southwest salmon wrap was just plain awful. I couldn't finish half of it and my boyfriend couldn't even take a bite. It was very mushy and tasted awful. I waited for the waitress to come over to tell her I couldn't eat it but she only came back to clear our plates. When she asked if I wanted a box because I didn't eat it I told her "no, I didn't like it". To which she just said okay and brought the check. She didn't offer anything to make up for it. The French fries were pretty good. But other than that, avoid it.

elZhgw1AvEh04OVr3C5Ydg.text: We had breakfast here on Sept.1st . Had a skillet which was just ok. Also had crepes . Worst crepes ever. Very dry and crispy. Also tasteless. Had to wait for syrup after asking server twice. Could'nt even eat the crepes. Ordered a side of strawberries which were old and mushy. Charged $3.85 for the strawberries when the menu clearly stated $1.00 . Should have sent crepes back but just decided what's the point. But by the time I went to pay could'nt hold back and complained to the cashier. She said she would tell the manager but did'nt offer to get the manager. Called manager after getting home but was told she could have taken care of everything had she known. Why did'nt the cashier offer to call her to the front. We were excited to try this place since they are putting.. one near us in Indian Land. Very disappointino!

-E4StJcCnHSiVeaMkUqQfA.text: I found this place by happenstance two weeks ago and within that time I've had bfast there 4 times already. Price, service, quality and space are all amazing. It's nestled into a corner where you'd think its a tiny restaurant but it's quite spacious. Get there early as 3 time out of my 4 I had to get take out. It's a good problem to have when a restaurant is busy.

573iEpa-3t0Ro8Ym3UrTXw.text: Just discovered this incredible place. The wait staff are sweet and friendly, super efficient and quick. There was no wait time, food was out in less than 10 mins. They have a plethora of lattes and cappuccinos with different flavors. (ex. Cinnamon bun latte!!) The have an override menu with upscale food. Low prices and awesome all around.

Q35FRRRXiGQtvFIrrOG0-A.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots in town. On weekday mornings, it's a nice spot to get some work done over a pot of tea and a hearty breakfast. On the weekends, it's perfect for brunch with the family. Love the mega skillet! Oh, and the crepes are yummy too!

qvMm3BxMTSZXG3Vf167_DA.text: We eat here pretty often. The Egg Benedict are to die for, as are the waffles. Was NOT a fan of the Mocha (it was much stronger than I expected it to be and just didn't enjoy it).

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sir Benedict with spinach instead of broccoli. Very yummy!!! ETA: Nothing overly special about the grits tho.
Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. Amazing. The waffle was so light and fluffy!! The eggs Benedict was simply dreamy good!!!

n4LnsQM_mPNlZVAjoqvHEg.text: Used to love this place. Come here for the crab cakes Benedict weekly. Well, used to. Did a to go order of the Benedict and it was burnt and dry. The cashier had an attitude. Lost my business.

4xkapZ72RpXBQLQ7LAwjLA.text: Wow. what a yummy surprise for breakfast - Harvest Benedict with Grits with my buddy Denise  great way to start this rainy weekend! the roasted veggies were such a nice surprise and cooked perfectly. glad we asked the hostess to tell us what she likes best!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. Harvest Benedict :-)

4yhYE_ZFLIb_9eBFXK2VbA.text: Regular breakfast, brunch, lunch spot. Nothing outstanding. Service was standard neither subservient or above par, same with the food. I ordered the chocolate chip pancakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. Choc chip pancakes

aPFeo5ffaBUcF-xn4ngirw.text: Good Breakfast spot in Charlotte to bring the family.   Their regular scrambled eggs and their egg whites are both excellent.  The coffee is strong, which is great because that's how we like it!  The French toast is good but just ok.  I think the food came out a little cold instead if fresh and hot from the kitchen, so I think they can do a little better with timing.   The service was pretty good, no complaints there!
