Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States

wr0pV4TqneWdkxNK5kIGQQ.text: I just love Le Peep! I discoverd them originally when I lived in Colorado and there was more stores then than now. What a shame, because this place is amazing. The food is always consistent and delicious. I had my favorite, eggs Benedict with the phesant potatoes and moms sassy apples ( these are so delicious). I have tried several dishes from the past and the present. They closed the only one they had where I love now so I have to seek them out when travleing to Texas or North Carolina. The wait staff is always friendly. If you are a fan of orange juice order some because it is fresh squeezed and delicious. I love you Le Peep!

PHhRS5-w12uD2KQKKMir9A.text: I went to brunch here today and we had a 30 min wait which was not too bad consider the crowd that was waiting as well! Once inside the ordering went quickly I never caught our waitress's name we had a party of 4 ladies and 2 children! They tried to seat us at a four top table against a wall. Which mean the two children would have been in the walk way. The hostess had left and did not see the problem but multiple servers were concerned and they moved us. The pancakes are AMAZING! I had the lumberjack breakfast with was bacon pancakes grits and eggs!   Everyone enjoyed their food! I would go again for the pancakes

AAzCw9dwH2ntu2wQj4AmOw.text: The restaurant ambiance and the service were top notch. I would ding a half-point on the food, but i don't think this place deserves that ding. I would highly recommend for breakfast/brunch!

re259cEZg5FOSxMDPE5MGw.text: Food was delicious. Service was great. Would definitely go back again.  I had the skillet and it did not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. A skillet with egg over easy

HAfM24ny9sQNzlja1Y2nsg.text: Stopped by on a Monday a little after noon and had a great meal. I had the bumper crop and subbed tomatoes for mushrooms with a side of fruit and bacon. Everything was amazing and the coffee was really good (I'm picky about my diner coffee). My friend got an omelette that was so big she took half home. She said that the grits were good but needed salt. Definitely will be returning!

bSUyoE2gIQjcdCm4B0fU_Q.text: Normally I skip breakfast.  This morning I had an early appointment and was starving afterward, so I popped in here.  I ordered the quiche of the day, which was broccoli and cheese.  My side was a hearty bowl of grits.  Loved the grits (hard to mess those up), but the quiche tasted a little strange to me.  There was something about the crust that didn't taste quite right.  The broccoli didn't taste fresh either.  I think this is a fine restaurant; I probably just ordered the wrong thing.  The service was okay.  The atmosphere is fine, especially for a breakfast place.   I will come back, but no more quiche for me.  Besides, real men don't eat quiche.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZdSnjdmOMo7VlPcwEG_q_A.text: This place is great. People here are friendly, the food is excellent and speedy. I especially love the Eggs Benedict, probably the best in Charlotte. We eat eat here as often as we can and only ever have one problem, the line (extra True on Sunday). I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a good breakfast/brunch/lunch place. Never been disappointed here

5vo5bsUo8k4TlXmhCT8uFg.text: I've been going to thus restaurant for over a decade and the service & food were always great, until yesterday. They must have been short staffed because there weren't that many people, yet it took forever to get our food. My omelette was way over cooked (burnt edges). I sent it back but didn't want a new one because we didn't have time to wait. When we finally got our check, the waitress wrote discount on the ticket and told the hostess to give me a discount. She took 20% off only. I've never been to a restaurant that fully didn't refund an order that was sent back for not being cooked properly.

7FY9IkSso27hXT5DjZqEKg.text: My two favorite breakfast chains are Original Pancake House and LePeep. They are tied. The skillet dishes at LePeep make me drive numerous miles out of the way to hit a restaurant. The chain is consistent in cleanliness, high quality products, and food prep. Service is always over the top in friendliness.  By the way I order same thing always Desperado Skillet.  Yummy

PhiRFOi_Osg3tfkMphl1ow.text: We waited for 10 mins on drinks while our waiter walked as slow as she possibly could to serve. When we did get our drinks there was hair in one of them floating on top (it was grey so definitely not ours) she took our order with no words except "are you ready to order" no "ok, yeah, what can I get you" or anything she just stared at my husband expecting him to order with no prompt too after me. After noticing her dirty hands and she even coughed in one of them before walking away from the table we left. We both had a bad feeling about the cleanliness. If your sick & working with peoples food then you should know better & stay home.

XAP3VkYefIVVK6-actJkfg.text: This bustling little European flavored restaurant is a local favorite. I love the festive bistro-like vibe and can understand its popularity yet personally have found the food and service to be just average over the years. In spite of that, I still seem to enjoy it a little more each time I go. Before today's breakfast  visit, it had been almost entire year since my last.  My wife and I ordered the Italian and Mediterranean crepes, which ran $8 each and included golden fried potato cubes as a side. The serving sizes were generous and the crepes were masterfully crafted - very thin with the perfect amount of golden browning - and beautifully plated.  The filling of the Italian was a bit dry; however, the Mediterranean filling consisting of diced chicken breast, spinach, onions tomatoes, feta cheese and black olives was quite good. In fact, I would order it again. We also enjoyed a couple of specialty lattes that were tasty, artistically created and very reasonably priced at around $3 each.  In the past, I have also tried the the 18 Wheeler, a simple breakfast combo comprised of Challa bread, two eggs over medium, two bacon slices and potatoes. At $9.25, it was a little pricey for breakfast, however, most everything was nicely prepared especially the skillet golden browned potatos. The Challa bread, which is just a fancy name for thick French toast, was just average at best however (as was the coffee.)  Service was very good and sanitation grade was an impressive 98 and is consistently in the high 90s. Of course the dining area was packed as usual. Again, although I don't love it, I do seem to like it a little more with each passing visit; that and readily available BOGO free coupons pretty much guarantee another meal there soon. With this review, I am also upgrading them from 3 stars to 4 for the first time; however in actuality, if Yelp allowed such precision, the new rating would be 3.75 up from 3.25.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Italian Crepe
Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Mediterranean Crepe

E6OSxs5-59ZuOFjbYWxr9w.text: The food is always good, we love the call ahead seating, but sometimes the wait staff can be a little surly.

X1qMaf4_u8BgtgftOSzmvg.text: Went for an early breakfast on Sunday and it was good as it was not that busy. Would give three stars and a half for overall. We ordered harvest egg benedict, french toast, regular breakfast dishes like eggs,bacon, grits and fruit. Specially I would give 4 stars for my egg benedict. It was perfectly cooked. Other dishes like eggs, bacon and grits were mediocre. Our server was attentive and service was good. It was good overall. This is a good casual brunch place!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States

_wLiEAP0YELX-pIcmdwLTQ.text: Le Peep's breakfast is amazing. The food comes out hot and quick and the service is quick as well. Servers always make sure to continue refilling your coffee, water, etc. throughout the entire visit. Even when there is a long wait you can never expect to be waiting too long thanks to the quick service. Great quality food and portions for the price, especially the skillets. Le Peep is a favorite of mine for breakfast and brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States

Xt4GP0tBMhGx9uPZOqL8MQ.text: Came here while in town visiting family and had a really great brunch! This is a nice little European style cafe in a busy shopping center on Providence Road. I didn't realize until now that Le Peep is actually a chain with locations in a couple different states!  The interior of this cafe was simple but also felt very out together and inviting. Our server was prompt and made sure our coffees stayed full. I had the harvest benedict which came with a side of potatoes. The benedict was delicious and the addition of sauteed mushrooms and spinach made it even better. The hollandaise sauce was fresh and flavorful. The potatoes were nice and crispy, a good compliment to the benedict. If looking for a breakfast in brunch place in Charlotte, I highly recommend this place!

sBLQJXeytoyC4NqaXzv6Tw.text: Where to start? I usually frequent stacks or metro diner- but am always open to trying new places so decided to give Le Peep a try, BIG mistake. They nickel and dime their patrons in really grotesque ways. For example, I ordered my children adult sized drinks and when I requested a refill I was told they only give refills to adult drinks, exactly so where's my refill? The children drank the juice so the adult only rule applied there. WOW, but the fun doesn't stop there. When I ordered our pancakes- I asked if we could have one chocolate chip and one regular, was told by the waitress no problem there just will likely be a charge. When I got my bill they charged $2 for a few chocolate chips on ONE pancake. Are you actually kidding? Lastly, the eggs were runny and the French toast was undercooked but that is nothing in comparison to the poor service we received.

ZNJi9RrZU69H4x9b_qDmBg.text: This has always been a favorite of ours for brunch. I had some friends that were from out of town that wanted to try this place out so we went. We didn't wait long for a table. Service was pretty slow. I got a sweet tea and there was absolutely no ice in it. It was warm. I had to ask for a cup of ice and that took forever to get. We finally ordered. Everyone got an assortment of items but most of us had bacon with our meals. We waited a while for our food but then the server came out and told us they were completely out of bacon. I do not see how that is possible. It's such a huge disappointment especially since the only option was to get sausage. They made our whole order and then told us about the bacon so we couldn't change our order. If I would of known they were out of bacon ahead of time, I wouldn't of gotten what I ordered. One person declined completely for a sausage substitute and the others just went ahead and got the sausage but most didn't eat it.   I just wish they should of known ahead of time they were out of bacon. An item like that should never be out of especially since there is a grocery store next door. It was also embarrassing taking my out of town friends here for such a disappointment. Our server was apologetic but it was obvious that there was nothing she could really do about it. Bad management.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pancakes
Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. Not fully crisp potatoes and my eggs were over cooked. And they ran out of bacon after I ordered so sausage was my only option. :(
Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken wrap and fries

LiYa1spNyRoNj_GILM04Rw.text: Went there one morning after I got off of work. It wasn't busy but I waited forever for my food. I ordered the French toast...bad choice. It was not good. See the pic. What French toast looks like that? Spend your money elsewhere!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States

DCb3poMB4fWg510thKqoyg.text: I love and crave their food so much that I wish they were open 24 hours so I could indulge any time I want! I've been eating and bringing my out of town guests here for breakfast, brunch & lunch since 2004. I've come to love some things that may not still be on the menu but can still be requested such as the Banana Brown Sugar pancake, the California Turkey Pita sandwich with grilled chicken instead of sliced turkey. I also often order my omlettes as a "mini" since they are usually too big for me to finish. I can't get enough of their Gooey Buns and bottomless carafes of coffee! Thank you for being you, Le Peep!

FKO461-tB-_AlWWHzPiUCw.text: Ok brunch place. Food was adequate. Not great, not terrible. I had the classic eggs benedict and was underwhelmed. The ratio of ham (one giant piece across 2 English muffins) and sauce was off. It needed smaller ham and more sauce. My dining companion had an omelet and grits. Overall the meal was ok. We weren't cleaning our plates, but we didn't leave hungry either.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grits, English muffin, veggie omelet
Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggs Benedict and skillet potatoes
Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. Omelet, burned English muffin, and grits

JOFNOA_Mlx2nAoZkLT1L7w.text: Ehh not a great meal to start off the new year.  The service was very slow and all the food was bland.  Between 5 of us we ordered a skillet, pancakes, French toast, red velvet waffles, and a Benedict-- Basically one item from each part of the menu. No one loved their food and we all agreed that nothing had a lot of flavor.   Unfortunately we were not too impressed and probably won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffle. Meh.
Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. Irish Benny
Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cinnamon Roll Latte

odRV0WYX4YdpC9WZyklouw.text: Go! Great breakfast! We've been on the prowl for a good big ol' breakfast and finally found one. The pancakes are HUGE and delicious! Great value for the money - $23 for the 2 of us, all in with tax and tip. Speedy, friendly service and generous portions. Go there. Now.

-35rNh3F6JUhYp22tr8QiA.text: Stopped in on a weekday to get eggs benedict.  I had the corn beef hash version and my wife had the traditional.  At 10.95 a plate, you expect something pretty good.  These were not.  Just bland.  The side of potatoes were even worse.  Fried potato nuggets, no seasoning, no onions, no peppers, just potatoes...plain.

6YqfwIXdUXTN-Pa_gSCbZw.text: Went here for Sunday breakfast on August 2, 2015. Cappuccino was ok, not great but our omelette arrived smothered in cheese which we didn't order so they took it back and rushed a replacement out and it was totally raw inside. The third try was ok but the potatoes were now cold as was the toast. I would skip this one as they have no attention to detail.

h2dChkAi686837R8eCGrmA.text: This rating is for poor customer service. I come to Le Peep about twice a week, not because it's my preference but because the selection is limited in the Arboretum for breakfast. This morning I call in my order as I always do and walk over to pick it up. A woman (I can only assume is the owner/ manager) brings it out and says to me, "the girls here told me you guys don't give them a discount." I looked at her a bit confused...I was just there to pick up my breakfast. She then went on about how they offer discounts to ppl that offer her employees a discount. (didn't  ask for a discount) I told her I work for a franchise and that we also offer our guest tons of ways to save. She then thought it was necessary to tell me the franchise I work for (not own) is pretty big. (Awkward silence) On my way out she told me to have a good day, and I told her to have a better one. Very inappropriate and way too early for the nonsense....I guess Manhattan will get all of my money now.

XcmEskXo0x2i1e0dkYiK6w.text: eggs Benedict- holandaise sauce was delicious. nice sized portions

A-15iKE2_h4aaGVsv8nivQ.text: Ate at Le Peep for the first time last week. Although my service was not particularly exceptional, my panini was delicious. Will I return? Most definitely.

W3LaGyhqrXM-UV-dnDWw7w.text: Super breakfast skillet selection and reasonably priced. Nice little breakfast/brunch cafe. Friendly and efficient staff. Good for children also.

vrKW3DLRUip1LPj5E8_lyQ.text: So yummy and affordable. I always bring out of town guest here for Sunday brunch!! Staff is always friendly, food has always been great. I usually stick to eggs, home style potatoes and turkey bacon but I always add a side of corn beef -so yummy!

NkUFmO90qdNJaEbPDrV1YQ.text: Subpar in many ways. In the mood for brunch, we decided to give this place a try. The menu looked promising but we left disappointed. The restaurant itself is an odd-shaped, loud room with an atmosphere that's just...sad. Like a half-hearted attempt at creating something along the lines of the South of France. I'm normally not the person that really cares about this stuff, but it was hard not to notice.  I ordered the Spanish omelette. It came with potatoes and I subbed the english muffin for fruit. Honestly, everything tasted like it was frozen and heated in the microwave ( it also arrived really quickly...). It was drenched in salsa and sour cream, which should probably compliment the eggs not cover the bad taste.  The potatoes were soft and mushy and lacked taste. A little seasoning may have been in order??  Our waitress was distant and every other staff member seemed to look miserable too. We questioned the cleanliness of our silverware, also.   Maybe it was just an off day but it's hard to do breakfast food wrong. Le Peep managed it. I wouldn't recommend.

XBwGkIDOFnvcXhhIBTMTSQ.text: Jay H. and his mom swear by the sandwiches at this place, but from what I've seen so far, everything here is good.  Le Peep is a chain, but it's run by individual franchise owners. The one here in Charlotte takes a lot of pride in her business, which you'll know right away when you meet her and her staff members. The service here is excellent. And the food. The food! There's plenty of it in every dish, and it's all made with fresh ingredients. Jay H. always gets the portobello panini, with its perfectly marinated 'shrooms. I've tried a few different breakfast items, and have always been happy. Highlights for me are the french toast and the Wanderer skillet, with fresh veggies and crisp potatoes. And they give you a whole pot of coffee, which means there's no waiting around for refills.  There's always a crowd here for weekend brunch, and in this case, trust the masses: for brunch in south Charlotte, this place is the best.

h7xKahojmS7FsTjY1dvOwA.text: More like Le Plop! Second time was NOT a charm. Thought I'd go back and give it another try after a mediocre breakfast the first time. I tried the "18 Wheeler". It comes with eggs, bacon or sausage, "peasant" potatoes and french toast. The meal was just bland, I've had a better breakfast at a T/A truck stop on Route 80. Eggs are eggs, link sausage was barely cooked, "peasant" potatoes were just that, poor! They lacked taste and texture. The french toast was two large pieces of bread, over dipped in a plain, tasteless batter. Using sliced sandwich bread for french toast was sub par for a restaurant with a name like Le Peep.   The service was fine, the waitress can't help the lack of ability in the kitchen. It has gotten dirtier from my last visit over 18 months ago. The carpet was dirty and the walls were banged up.   Le Plop needs a face lift. In agreeing with the other yelpers, the decor is lacking. There weren't many patrons dining during my visit and it was extremely loud.   Good Luck! It seems their weekend faithfuls keep them afloat! Does the South lack taste buds and palates?

t7vKzZU4l-dngrp8m9Huyg.text: It was good solid brunch food, but it's not really anything I'd crave again.

DqGNLz-5VhH684cIcZNyTw.text: I tried this place for the first time today.   Pros:  - Quantity of food: When they say two large eggs come with the meal, they mean it. I thought it was like 3.5 eggs. - Service: They were pretty fast for a Sunday morning. The server told me the corned beef hash came from a can which allowed me to make the informed choice not to get it.  Cons: - Their signature peasant potatoes could have used some seasoning. They tasted dry. Maybe I caught them on an off day but they have potential. In fact, most of the food could stand some seasoning.  Verdict: I would go here again. The pancakes looked really good. It's about the same price as Cracker Barrel with larger servings and less flavor. Better seasoning would have garnered a 4-star rating from me.

xRkQZx0QatV0VYaBaPrwdg.text: Been once. This place has a book for a menu with so many options for breakfast or lunch. It's a brunch type of place, where old people like to go. You can tell by seeing the crowd dining in this place. Nonetheless, the food is just typical breakfast food that comes out in big portions. The service is ordinary and a great place to go!  It's a great place to go with groups and kids as well. Easy to find restaurant.

B-gyaO6o_h2h7UWrNoUEfg.text: We heard a lot about the breakfast here so decided to head over on a Saturday morning. I had the bacon, egg and cheese sandwich. I don't even remember what my fiance got, but I do remember her impression of her breakfast was as unmemorable as mine. With the options for breakfast in Charlotte, this is not a place we'll head back to soon.

Yy2-fUotET6_LSlIGBug2Q.text: I thought that Le Peep's was very good.  I liked how it was not such a big place, but the right size.  I had ordered the Desperado skillet and really enjoyed it.  It was a pretty big size that I wasn't expecting so much!  I had to bring some of it home.  It was still tasty when I ate it later.  I do recommend this place.

c7WJx127bSvj0F8Inq2zCg.text: I've been here twice now.  I don't remember what I had the first time, but I did have the  chicken pesto panini this time.  It was ok.  I had the salad for the side with the balsamic vinaigrette dressing.  This is probably the worst dressing I've had.  It's water-based & just terrible.  You can always judge a place by it's salad dressing.  I doubt I will be back.

RDo-ipGvIe4FLsjUGFSbIQ.text: If you enjoy dining with flies, then look no further! Le peep is the place for you! Three stars, really? I mean, really? I don't know about anyone else, but I don't want my food with a side of fly. Flies, flies, everywhere--even near my food!  If the fly-fest at brunch wasn't enough, the service at Le Peep was just as terrible. So bad in fact that I would even go so far as to say it was the worst service I'd ever had. And the place was empty, only two other tables besides mine were occupied, so the busy excuse is out the window. And the food, dear God, the food was foul. So terrible that after taking one bite, I had to cover the offending plate with the only napkin I'd been given, so as not to be reminded of it's taste. And the atmosphere--what atmosphere? Mcdonald's has a better atmosphere than Le Peep. And at Mcdonald's I don't feel the need to be armed at the ready with a flyswatter in each hand. What a filthy restaurant. I took a shower when I got home.  Three stars? Come on. Even in Charlotte, where good food is nothing but a fanciful dream, this was bad--shockingly bad. This place deserves negative stars! Better yet, shut it down.

cyMzO8-hdIbJ7Gg4Z8_CzQ.text: The name LePeep reminds people of Eggs Benedict.  That is a double-edged sword.  My bene was the "Crab cake" one.  I would have like REAL crab in there though.  Imitation crab meat is nothing more than fish, chopped, formed into strings and dyed on the edges.  It resembles vinyl.  Tasted like it too.  Especially since one side was burned black as pavement, while the other side never touched the grill.  Add the uncooked English muffin, overcooked poached egg, and you really don't have a winner.  But hey- they did cover it in hollandaise sauce, so I couldn't see it.  it's all good now right?

vhk5_8ekxvFmThaBO5HISA.text: Love this place and yea, we are foodies, eating in a non foodie world here. We will try anything, love fancy, love holes in the wall, and like local, local local. Yea, this place isn't anything special on the fancy side or foodie side nor is it a hole in the wall. Just your average brunch/lunch place in atmosphere and surroundings. Locally franchised. HOWEVER, having tried EVERY, and I swear, EVERY brunch spot in South Charlotte, from the Terrace Cafe's of the world, to Skillet's (now Broken Egg), to New South (next door to Le Peep), to Vine American Kitchen, 131 Main, Flying Biscuit, Big View (YUCK!) etc. etc. etc. this one actually has the highest rating for us next to Terrace Cafe. The skillets are yummo, our eggs are always perfectly cooked as ordered, the kids menu sufficient and pleasing with coloring and games to boot, and the service is ALWAYS good. They are consistent, have a very large and diverse menu, something for everyone. The crab cake benedict is a tad heavy on the breadcrumbs and less on the crab side but hey, this isn't your froo froo brunch spot, so have realistic expectations when you go and order accordingly. My other half got the corned beef hash skillet on his first visit here with us and blurted out "FINALLY"! He had finally found a spot in South Charlotte with the salty NJ diner type hash he had been seeking, not fried potatoes some places actually call "hash". This is a favorite spot of ours, make it one of yours too!

RITdNasHxJeQ-gWBHW5XuQ.text: I went to the Le Peep in Orlando once for brunch in the early 2000s.  I was amazed by the 80s country decor with hunter green tones.  (Note: sarcasm.)  After moving to Charlotte and not aware yet of any brunch places, we decided to give the Le Peep here a try.  Wow--same thing.  It's like every Le Peep was built in the 80s and hasn't changed a thing since.  Their menu items for brunch are pretty good, but the atmosphere kills it for me.  You'd do better going to Good Ol' Days just on the other side of the Arboretum shopping plaza.  1950s decor = cool.  1980s decor = uncool.  But maybe if they wait around a couple more decades they'll be considered "retro."  Who knows?  For me, now that I've discovered them, there are much better brunch options in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States

fjjzAn0j6zCs2SNViuNfwQ.text: We enjoyed our first visit for breakfast, the meals were exactly as described in the menu. I had the Greek omelet and was very good, my husband ordered the eggs, corn beef and hash and he said it was the best he had in a while. The service was really good and the restaurant was clean, we will definitely go back!

Wl3msWfmQIxq6ufKVcJQhQ.text: The food was yummy and impressive from the crab cakes benedict to the breakfast wrap. The service was great as well. One hint, visit during the week days for more immediate service.

v330WVEi3A3z5LaaQHE1wQ.text: The food was good but the place is slightly cramped and by the time we left there was a huge line waiting. I'd go back if I was in the area, but wouldn't make a trip especially for that. I had the Irish eggs Benedict and it was really good... My girlfriend had the French toast (add crunch for a dollar which was just Frosted Flakes) and she was not thrilled with hers, so I lost half my delicious meal in the process

ZzkolqfiTkz5c1F7I-XQwA.text: We made the mistake of going out for brunch at 2 pm, which seems to be the a no-no in Charlotte. So I see this sign that says "breakfast served ALL day" and I figured out perfect!  Our first visit there (and last) I'm trying to figure out the menu. I ask the waitress "it says here all scrambled eggs" can I have sunny side up instead?". She says "Of course, anyway you want them other than hardboiled!"  Five minutes later I decide to order the "dawn breaker" special with fried eggs, the waitress says"no that one is only available with scrambled eggs and you HAVE TO hurry up because the kitchen closes at 2:30"  "someone could have let us know before they sat us down, outside it says ALL day"  she answers "but it doesn't say dinner!"  Good move dummy trying to win an argument with the client. I tell her ok but I want the eggs lightly scrambled not well done.  And of course I got scrambled eggs so overcooked they were hard enough to be hard boiled, and the bacon was MIA from the plate and the country potatoes were frozen. The reason I gave them 2 stars instead of 1 is because when I told the waitress that no, the food was not good she got the manager who came over, inquired and adjusted the bill. It still came to $11 for a salad and two coffees but I was not in the mood to go over the bill.  When I stepped outside there were several dark grey streaks of grease from the seat on the back of my left calf, luckily I was wearing shorts. WTH that really takes the cherry.

sfCAe8rMbhWn-Clm6Kf2GA.text: Brought my youngest to breakfast here.  We were seated right away, and ordered within about 10 minutes.  Our food was out in a reasonable amount of time.  My Spinnaker (egg white omelet with mushrooms, bacon, and spinach) was pretty good, although I ended up eating around a lot of the bacon.  It wasn't crispy, and seemed kind of flabby.  Ew.  Overall though, it was pretty decent for egg whites.  The potatoes were pretty good.  Seasoned well, and not as greasy as in many places.  My meal also came with an English muffin, either white or honey wheat.  My son ordered a funny face pancake.  Now, I know that this is going to sound picky, but the pancake started with the standard round pancake, with a face made with whipped cream and a couple of pieces of fruit.  It got a little weird when they added 2 ears, sort of like Mickey Mouse.  If Mickey had gotten caught in some kind of farm machinery.  One ear was maybe 2 inches around.  The other was huge, and more like a giant tumor off of the head part.  Seems like if you are going to bother trying to make it fun for kids, just do it right.  If you are pouring a pancake and see that you have totally jacked it up, stop cooking that one and pour another one.  It's maybe a few cents worth of wasted batter, right?  The pancake tasted fine, but the syrup container they brought was SO hot that we couldn't touch it.  The waitress even warned us about it.  I tried to let it cool for a minute, but then our food was getting cold.  I ended up grabbing it with a napkin like a pot holder, but it was really a mess.  After eating, we waited.  And waited.  I tried to make eye contact with our waitress, but she walked over to a table and sat down, talking to a customer.  Seemed like she was also taking his order, but also just chatting.  I dunno... I wouldn't rule out returning, but I'm not going to go out of my way to do so.

vbMe1k_BBMi2y0tkuP2g_Q.text: I guess I was expecting to be transported to a quaint little French Bistro when I walked into La Peep. The name lends itself to that don't you think? Sadly I walked into a dark, dated, cave like environment  with the testosterone level well over 100%.  My dear friend and I were the only ladies in the place. It was rather strange. The service was fine. I had the egg, tomato and artichoke scramble and let me tell you, it was the UGLIEST plate of food I have ever seen but very tasty! I would order it again and maybe this time eat it blindfolded hehe.

CW8bi2Oo-YIMr_o0j1frdg.text: Have had hundreds of breakfasts over the years.  Consistently good breakfast food.  Good prices and generally outstanding service.  Plenty of choices from lighter fare to traditional American breakfast to full on steak and eggs, large omelets, etc.  Nice atmosphere.  Convenient and fast.  Update based on more recent visits:  Breakfasts are not as good as in years past.  They used to serve the plates overflowing with food.  You paid $6 for a basic American breakfast but you got sausage or bacon, eggs, grits or potatoes and toast or an english muffin.  What was once a LOT of food is now just sort of enough.  And the cost is almost double.  Add coffee, tax and tip and you should be getting a premium breakfast.  This is more what you'd expect at a Denny's.  The staff is nice but won't really go out of their way for you.  It's an OK place but there are a lot of alternatives.

wGXiN4CXf9oAZbfRVv4gxA.text: I have been eating breakfast at Le Peep's for 6 years or more, and have never been disappointed. I believe this is 1 of the top 3 best breakfast places in South Charlotte. Everything is good.  Ask for their dark roast coffee, it's the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. A great South Charlotte breakfast place.

EjL9nucfZQvrX3IdDWZ3Ew.text: The service is always great.  The food is good but not fantastic.  My wife's french toast came out soggy in the middle for the second time recently.  Other than that, every thing seems to be cooked right.  We think when it's busy (Sunday am) they turn up the heat to speed things up, but they don't want to overcook, so the middle doesn't cook enough...just a theory.  Nothing worse than raw eggs on your french toast though.  The menu needs to be updated.  Too many bland dishes.  It's good food overall though, but nothing really sticks out.   For example, I had the Desperado which is probably one of their most flavorful dishes.  It's a skillet with potatoes, peppers, onions, cheese, this mexican type sausage (can tasted cilantro in it i believe,) salsa and two eggs on top.  The sausage is unique, but just decent, not great.  Good overall, but I was not blown away.  The salsa tastes like newsman's own, which is great for dipping chips; but probably should be substituted with something else.  Lots of hearty meals on the menu and they do those very well.  They do bacon, eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy, and country potatoes very well.   So if you're in the mood for that type of breakfast I recommend it.

hcTRB57lj6ZO8JhDIIBjMA.text: Le Peep is an awesome brunch place. It's never very crowded, which is refreshing in Charlotte, where many of the breakfast and brunch places get overwhelming, especially on the weekends. It's bright and cozy inside, and it's great for conversation.   There aren't lots of vegetarian options on the menu other than the pancakes and waffles, but the staff is flexible and willing to help you set something nice up. I had the California Turkey panini without the turkey and bacon, and the waiter didn't even give me any attitude about changing the menu options. There's also lots of breakfasty-stuff, so it's one of those wonderful places where it's kind of safe to bring anyone...no matter if the group wants lunch or breakfast or meat or vegetarian or sweets or whatever...Le Peep can accomodate.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Peep - Charlotte, NC, United States. Le Peep&#39;s logo, from their website

mx3F2dbXL-38_Pl5Aj1zsw.text: A great breakfast/brunch spot. The skillets are great (very large) and the omelettes were delicious. Note: I've been 4 times but only for breakfast.  The ingredients seem fresher than typical diner.   For some bizarre reason the salsa is served piping hot, which doesn't work. They have to cool it down for you (they don't keep any cold). This has happened all 4 times for me.   Tables only: no booths. Attentive friendly staff.  Frequent diner card available.   All in all a great brunch place in the arboretum.

XD2yFsLrowEG7s-AFgfQng.text: The food was very good, and our waitress was friendly. The hostess, however, was not. She did not smile once, in fact, she seemed annoyed at us for being there. She didn't greet us, she just stared at us with an annoyed look on her face, like she was waiting for us to explain what we were doing there. A hostess is the first person you see when you walk into a restaurant, and the way they treat you sets the tone for your entire visit. We love the food at Le Peep, it's good, simple food that's cooked well. But it makes us not want to come back when the staff is rude.

Z2Z36J7v3AcS5ow-vdeS2Q.text: Food is Delicious!!! Just went two days in a row.  The manager is very friendly and doesn't mind sharing her favorite dishes!!! My mom seemingly the pickiest eater ever....is able to find something she loves or at least put it together.

6WZlj6uxjQq5FnTKzfkLgQ.text: Their biscuits and gravy just ain't that good.  All I kept hearing is "You gotta try the biscuits and gravy".  Save yourself and don't.  The omelettes are good - you won't go home hungry.  I wish they had hash browns but they have home fries.  Expansive menu could get confusing and time consuming if you can't make up your mind.   They leave a carafe of coffee on the table - that's a plus.  It's actually kind of expensive for a breakfast spot.  Go early or call ahead on Sundays.  It gets packed - people like their breakfast here in the South.

nZK8NCRBoSO5RCvA4zAOww.text: Amazing! Delicious! Must Have!  Ordered Crab Cakes Benedict, Belgian Waffle, and White Mocha. Yes that's 2 dishes but hahaha I couldn't decided and I wanted it all. Egg was poached perfectly. Crab cakes was full of real crab meat and not overwhelmed by bread crumbs. Belgian Waffle was scrumptious. White Mocha was incredible.   I'd recommend to all. Everyone is kind and very warming. Will visit on a monthly basis.   Love it!!!!

DzaJwPDmkV7giIF8phvmAA.text: Great place for a party no bigger than four. Not huge, but quaint and it utilizes the place to its capacity for dining. Menu's healthy and eccentric. Service is on-time and the though the place looks congested upon arrival, the traffic flows to where you're seated within ten minutes of your arrival AT THE LATEST. No complaints about the food whatsoever. I even want to re-visit to try something different.

3KSuXXjUVYRgL8o1Hipxew.text: South Charlotte, while having an abundance of most everything else, seems to have a lack of quality breakfast establishments. Enter Le Peep.  While not being a super flashy joint, Le Peep doles out fresh and tasty breakfast items that satisfy the senses. My choice today - tomato and cheese omelet. The hubbys pick - banana and strawberry crepes. The best part - you'll find neither item on the menu. They totally let us customize and create our own (good thing since I'm a veg-head). The waitress didn't even blink when hubby made his strange (yet super yummy) pick. Just smiled and said "sounds good"! Breakfast isn't breakfast with out a good cup o' Joe. Le Peep delivered yet again. My own carafe of coffee on the table. And good coffee at that!  Waitstaff was good - we weren't bothered by them much, yet we weren't ignored either. Service was fast and correct.  Just a few things to point out : I saw no flies like a previous reviewer said. Zip. Zero. None. There wasn't a wait when we went, despite the fact that it was 10:30 on a Saturday.  We caught a glimpse of the pancakes - HUGE! They over took the plate.  Last word: I'd go again. I plan on Taking the 'rents here when they are in town next time.

c8vLWWwG0ttd-dYdM7FO3A.text: Had breakfast here on Saturday with the kids. We got seated right away although the place seemed very busy.   My executive summary of the place is this:  - The food is just regular breakfast fare, nothing special. I had the Spinach Omelette which was OK but really just like any other Spinach Omelette somewhere else.   - The decor and resulting atmophere is bad! To us it felt very cold and unfriendly, almost like sitting in a bus station... just like a large, unfinished room.  We won't be back.

phKV15erzdbkenq-vjKNsQ.text: ALMOST a quaint hole in the wall feeling for the queen of all suburb towns.  ALMOST.  But no.  Charlotte is forever doomed to suburban boredom.
